abstract: Diane J Horvath-Cosper, obstetrician and gynecologist who performs abortions at MedStar Washington Hospital Center, files federal civil rights complaint claiming her superiors prohibited her from publicly defending abortion out of concern for security; silencing of prominent pro-choice advocate underscores debate over whether fears about anti-abortion violence undermine efforts to counter procedure's stigmatization.

headline.print_headline: Silence Order on Abortions Violates Law, Doctor Says
headline.main: Doctor, Warned to Be Silent on Abortions, Files Civil Rights Complaint

snippet: A Washington doctor said hospital officials broke the law by ordering her to stop publicly defending abortion after the Colorado shooting in November.
lead_paragraph: A Washington doctor said hospital officials broke the law by ordering her to stop publicly defending abortion after the Colorado shooting in November.
